psalm.text:
[[Ps 145,10]]Let all your works give you thanks, O LORD,
and let your faithful ones bless you.
[[Ps 145,11]]Let them discourse of the glory of your Kingdom 
and speak of your might.

[[Ps 145,12]]Making known to men your might 
and the glorious splendor of your Kingdom.
[[Ps 145,13a]]Your Kingdom is a Kingdom for all ages,
[[Ps 145,13b]]and your dominion endures through all generations.

[[Ps 145,17]]The LORD is just in all his ways 
and holy in all his works.
[[Ps 145,18]]The LORD is near to all who call upon him, 
to all who call upon him in truth.
psalm.title: Psalms

gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint John
gospel.text:
[[Jn 1,45]]Philip found Nathanael and told him, "We have found the one about whom Moses wrote in the law, and also the prophets, Jesus, son of Joseph, from Nazareth."
[[Jn 1,46]]But Nathanael said to him, "Can anything good come from Nazareth?" Philip said to him, "Come and see."
[[Jn 1,47]]Jesus saw Nathanael coming toward him and said of him, "Here is a true Israelite. There is no duplicity in him."
[[Jn 1,48]]Nathanael said to him, "How do you know me?" Jesus answered and said to him, "Before Philip called you, I saw you under the fig tree."
[[Jn 1,49]]Nathanael answered him, "Rabbi, you are the Son of God; you are the King of Israel."
[[Jn 1,50]]Jesus answered and said to him, "Do you believe because I told you that I saw you under the fig tree? You will see greater things than this."
[[Jn 1,51]]And he said to him, "Amen, amen, I say to you, you will see the sky opened and the angels of God ascending and descending on the Son of Man."

first_reading.text:
[[Ap 21,9b]]The angel spoke to me, saying, "Come here. I will show you the bride, the wife of the Lamb."
[[Ap 21,10]]He took me in spirit to a great, high mountain and showed me the holy city Jerusalem coming down out of heaven from God.
[[Ap 21,11]]It gleamed with the splendor of God. Its radiance was like that of a precious stone, like jasper, clear as crystal.
[[Ap 21,12]]It had a massive, high wall, with twelve gates where twelve angels were stationed and on which names were inscribed, (the names) of the twelve tribes of the Israelites.
[[Ap 21,13]]There were three gates facing east, three north, three south, and three west.
[[Ap 21,14]]The wall of the city had twelve courses of stones as its foundation, on which were inscribed the twelve names of the twelve apostles of the Lamb.
first_reading.title: Book of Revelation
